title: Lipids in microalgae: The Extraction by modified Folch solvent

source.body: In order to obtain a biphase system to separate the extract from water, the final composition of CHCl3:MeOH:H2O is 8:4:3 (v/v)

In order to avoid the loss of sample, before transfering extract into the funnel, check if the funnel is well assembled with the base by clamp.

The neck of the base must touch the inner side of the graduated cylinder, so that the filtrate can be all collected in the cylinder. In order to maintain the balance of air pressure, leave gap between the neck and the cylider.
Slowly and steadily push the plunger to force the filtrate into the graduated cylinder.
Record the volume (V) of the filtrate in the cylinder to an accuracy of 0.1 ml.

description: In this protocol, lipids in miroalgae is extracted with 2 ml Folch solvent (2:1 chloroform-methanol v/v) after frozen and thawed with the addition of 100 ul water. Non-lipid substances are removed by filtration. Filtrate is then mixed with 0.88% potassium chloride solution to form a biphase system. The lower phase with extracted lipids are collected and dried under N2 gas flow. The residue is dissolved in 5 ml chloroform and stored under -80 ºC.
